thread.title: Vicky Pattison discusses Blind Date presenting job and how Cilla Black's feels about it
thread.title_full: Vicky Pattison discusses Blind Date presenting job and how Cilla Black's feels about it

author: Nicola Agius
title: Vicky Pattison discusses Blind Date presenting job and how Cilla Black's feels about it
text:
Vicky Pattison discusses Blind Date presenting job and how Cilla Black's feels about it The Geordie Shore beauty has received dozens of messages congratulating her on 'the role' Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Vicky Pattison has her "fingers crossed" she'll land the Blind Date presenting job. 
The former Geordie Shore star is one of the names in the frame to front the dating show - which was previously hosted by the late Cilla Black - when it returns to TV, and she'd love to get the gig, although she's embarrassed so many people have already congratulated her on the position. 
Speaking to Heat magazine, the brunette beauty: "I'm as thrown by the rumours as everyone else. I've got 30 WhatsApps, all like, 'Congrats.' 
"I can't bring myself to reply because what can I say? I've not got the job, it's embarrassing. But fingers crossed! Vicky Pattison March 09, 2016 Celebrities are seen attending the Jake Quickenden EP Launch Party (Photo: FameFlynet) 
"And I love Cilla's son for saying I'd do a good job." Read More 
Meanwhile, Vicky is so smitten with her boyfriend John Noble, and is already thinking about marriage. Cilla Black previously hosted the show (Photo: LWT) 
She said: "John makes me want to be the best version of myself. 
"I've finally found what I've been looking for. I'm so happy. 
"I'm starting to think this will be my wedding body. That's not far off, I don't think." Vicky with boyfriend John Noble 
While the 29-year-old beauty enjoys working out, she'd never want to be more muscular than her partner, because she would fear her partner would feel less masculine if during an intimate sex session she was to secretly compare their body shapes only to realise her toned torso was better than his. 
She explained: "I want to be a bit more toned. If my boyfriend looked down when we were having sex and saw I had a better six-pack than him, I imagine he'd lose his erection." Like us on Facebook
